content: Donghan Kim is a Computer Science student at 42 Paris, pursuing a Master's degree (RNCP Level 7) in Computer Science. He is passionate about AI/ML and enjoys solving complex problems, learning new technologies, and building robust, scalable systems that bridge the gap between development and operations.
Donghan Kim's GitHub is https://github.com/Donghan5. His LinkedIn is https://www.linkedin.com/in/donghan-kim01. His email is donghank@student.42.fr.
Donghan Kim's tech stack includes: C, C++, Python, Go, TypeScript, React, Bash, Linux, Docker, Git, TailwindCSS, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Kafka, Redis, Nest.js, Node.js, and Socket.io.

Donghan Kim is proficient in systems programming languages (C, C++, Assembly) and modern application languages (Python, Go, TypeScript). He has strong experience with both low-level and high-level programming.
Donghan Kim has DevOps skills including Docker containerization, Kubernetes orchestration, CI/CD pipelines, Nginx configuration, and Linux system administration.
Donghan Kim has AI/ML skills including Machine Learning, Deep Learning, linear regression, multilayer perceptrons (neural networks), and is working towards implementing Transformers from scratch.

Donghan Kim is currently a CS student at 42 Paris (2024 - Present), pursuing RNCP Level 7 (Master's equivalent) in Computer Science. He developed foundational skills through project-based learning, including low-level programming in C/C++, system administration (Born2beRoot), and deploying containerized applications with Docker (Inception).

Donghan Kim served as a Sergeant in the Republic of Korea Army (2020 - 2022). He was responsible for training and leading a team of soldiers in the field, maintaining equipment and facilities, and ensuring safety and security. He participated in demining operations.

Weather app: A weather application built with React and TypeScript, using the OpenWeatherMap API to fetch real-time weather data. Features include current weather, 5-day forecast, and search functionality for specific locations. Tech stack: React, TypeScript, TailwindCSS, OpenWeatherMap API. GitHub: https://github.com/Donghan5/weather_app

E-commerce API: A RESTful API for an e-commerce platform built with Typescript and Go using the Gin framework. Features include user authentication, product management, order processing, and payment integration. Uses PostgreSQL for data storage and Docker for containerization. Tech stack: Go, TypeScript (nest.js), PostgreSQL, Docker. GitHub: https://github.com/Donghan5/ecommerce_api

weather_api: A weather API service that provides current weather data and forecasts. Implements 2 servers with Go and Typescript (Nest.js), using Redis for caching. Tech stack: Go, Typescript (nest.js), Redis. GitHub: https://github.com/Donghan5/weather_api

chatapp: A full-stack chat application with real-time messaging, user authentication, and group chats. Deployed using Kubernetes with a CI/CD pipeline. Tech stack: React, Typescript, Node.js, PostgreSQL, Kafka, K8s. GitHub: https://github.com/Donghan5/chatapp

ft_linear_regression: Implemented basic linear regression from scratch using Python and Numpy. This is a machine learning project from 42 Paris. GitHub: https://github.com/Donghan5/ft_linear_regression

multilayer-perceptron: Implemented a Multilayer Perceptron (MLP) neural network from scratch using Python, Numpy, and Pandas. This is a deep learning project from 42 Paris. GitHub: https://github.com/Donghan5/multilayer_perceptron

learning_kafka: Understanding of Kafka concepts and data-pipeline through hands-on projects, with a goal of understanding fundamental principles. Tech stack: Kafka, Data Engineering, Python. GitHub: https://github.com/Donghan5/learning_kafka

Understanding of ML: Understanding of Machine Learning concepts and algorithms through hands-on projects, with a goal of implementing Transformers. Tech stack: Python, C++, C, ML. GitHub: https://github.com/Donghan5/Understanding_of_ML
libasm: A low-level programming library written in Assembly, focusing on Unix system calls and interfacing. Tech stack: Assembly, Low-Level. GitHub: https://github.com/Donghan5/libasm

ft_transcendence: Developed a full-stack web application featuring real-time multiplayer Pong, chat, and user profiles. Tech stack: TypeScript, Full-Stack, Web App. GitHub: https://github.com/Donghan5/ft_transcendence

Inception: Set up a multi-container infrastructure using Docker and docker-compose, including services like Nginx, WordPress, and MariaDB. This project demonstrates Docker and system administration skills. Tech stack: Docker, System Admin, Nginx. GitHub: https://github.com/Donghan5/inception

webserv: Developed a simple HTTP server in C++ that handles GET and POST requests, demonstrating understanding of web protocols and networking. Tech stack: C++, Networking, HTTP. GitHub: https://github.com/Donghan5/webserv
CPP Modules: Completed a series of C++ modules (00-09) to master object-oriented programming concepts and practices at 42 Paris. Tech stack: C++, OOP. GitHub: https://github.com/Donghan5/CPP_Modules

miniRT: Implemented a ray tracing engine in C to render 3D scenes with various geometric objects and lighting effects. This project demonstrates graphics programming. Tech stack: C, Graphics, Ray Tracing. GitHub: https://github.com/Donghan5/miniRT

minishell: Developed a simple UNIX shell implementation with command parsing, execution, and basic job control features. Tech stack: C, System Programming, Shell. GitHub: https://github.com/Donghan5/minishell

Philosophers: Solved the dining philosophers problem using C threads and mutexes to prevent deadlocks and ensure fair resource access. Tech stack: C, Multithreading, Concurrency. GitHub: https://github.com/Donghan5/philosopher

push_swap: Created an efficient algorithm to sort a stack of numbers with limited operations, optimizing for the fewest moves. Tech stack: C, Algorithm, Sorting. GitHub: https://github.com/Donghan5/push_swap
ft_printf: Implemented a custom printf function in C to handle formatted output with variable argument lists. Tech stack: C, Library, Formatting. GitHub: https://github.com/Donghan5/ft_printf

get_next_line: Implemented a function to read a line from a file descriptor, handling multiple files and dynamic memory allocation. Tech stack: C, File I/O, Buffering. GitHub: https://github.com/Donghan5/get_next_line
Libft: Developed a custom C library with essential functions to enhance programming efficiency and code reusability. Tech stack: C, Library, Utilities. GitHub: https://github.com/Donghan5/Libft
